documentation.text:
!!!IMPORTANT!!! NOTE: Only whitelisted ERC20 will move to dfinance network.
 Deposit ERC20 into Peggy.
 Whitelist is stored on Dfinance part.
 Validators use transaction ID as unique ID for processing deposit.
 Emits a {Deposit} event.

documentation.text:
This updates the valset by checking that the validators in the current valset have signed off on the
 new valset. The signatures supplied are the signatures of the current valset over the checkpoint hash
 generated from the new valset.
 Emits a {ValsetUpdated} event.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Peggy: supplied current validators and powers do not match checkpoint"

documentation.text:
Withdraw function.
 Accepting id, erc20 address, destination.
 Also requires validators, powers.
 Anyone can submit.
 Emits a {Withdraw} event.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address[] memory,uint256[] memory,uint8[] memory,bytes32[] memory,bytes32[] memory,bytes32,uint256) pure

documentation.text:
This updates the valset by checking that the validators in the current valset have signed off on the
 new valset. The signatures supplied are the signatures of the current valset over the checkpoint hash
 generated from the new valset.
 Emits a {ValsetUpdated} event.

documentation.text:
Withdraw function.
 Accepting id, erc20 address, destination.
 Also requires validators, powers.
 Anyone can submit.
 Emits a {Withdraw} event.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address[] memory,uint256[] memory,uint8[] memory,bytes32[] memory,bytes32[] memory,bytes32,uint256) pure

deposit(address,bytes32,uint256).notice: !!!IMPORTANT!!! NOTE: Only whitelisted ERC20 will move to dfinance network. Deposit ERC20 into Peggy. Whitelist is stored on Dfinance part. Validators use transaction ID as unique ID for processing deposit. Emits a {Deposit} event.

updateValset(address[],uint256[],uint256.notice: This updates the valset by checking that the validators in the current valset have signed off on the new valset. The signatures supplied are the signatures of the current valset over the checkpoint hash generated from the new valset. Emits a {ValsetUpdated} event.

withdraw(bytes32,address,address,uint256.notice: Withdraw function. Accepting id, erc20 address, destination. Also requires validators, powers. Anyone can submit. Emits a {Withdraw} event.
